title: Probe the Milky Way Density Structure
brief: Astrophysics research analyzing galactic density distribution using computational modeling and data analysis.

subtitles.title: Project Description
subtitles.content: Used Gaia DR3 stellar catalogues and a Milky Way–like N-body simulation to probe the Galaxy’s bar and density structure. I trained a TensorFlow model on Gaia photometry to automatically identify red clump giants (standard-candle tracers), then applied the classifier to hundreds of millions of stars and to the simulation to locate bar-induced dark gaps and compare observed and simulated density patterns.

subtitles.title: My Responsibility
subtitles.content:
Cleaned and filtered Gaia DR data; constructed training and test samples. 
Implemented and tuned the TensorFlow red-clump classifier; evaluated accuracy on held-out data.
Applied the trained model to both Gaia data and the N-body simulation and generated comparison plots/maps.

Interpreted the density profiles of the bar and dark gaps with the team and designed the research poster summarizing results.

subtitles.title: Tech Stack
subtitles.content: Python, NumPy, pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib, Astropy
